article.headline: American 75, NJIT 50
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP) -- Arvydas Eitutavicius scored a season-high 20 points and American pulled away to a 75-50 victory over the New Jersey Institute of Technology on Wednesday night. Linas Lekavicius added a season-high 16 points, and Derrick Mercer had 13 points and seven assists for the Eagles (5-2), who improved to 3-0 at home. Andrew Englel scored 16 points and Alex Stone added 10 for the Highlanders (2-4), who lost their fourth straight have been outscored by 49 points combined in their last two contests. The Eagles opened the second half on a 12-3 run to push their lead to 48-35 after Eitutavicius hit a 3-pointer and two free throws to put American up 36-32 at halftime. Later in the second half, another 10-0 spurt made it 68-44 with less than five minutes to play, capped by inside baskets from Lekavicius and Brayden Billbe. The Highlanders never got closer than 18 after that. Andre Ingram, American's leading scorer this season, was held scoreless for the first time in his career.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
